main event: A white object the size of a dime was seen flying with the curvature of the earth in Lexington, KY on 7th March 1953 for 2 to 3 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as flying with the curvature of the earth, indicating a curved path.
Despite being in sight for only 2 to 3 seconds, the observation included details such as the size of the object and its flight path.
The report states that there were photos taken, suggesting potential photographic evidence of the sighting.
The assessment concluded that the object was likely a meteorite, based on its description, duration, and flight path.
The brevity of the sighting and the small size of the object are notable aspects of this report.
sighted object: a white object the size of a dime
